com.oracle.tools.runtime.java.process
Class VirtualProcessMethodInvoker

java.lang.Object
  com.oracle.tools.runtime.java.process.VirtualProcessMethodInvoker
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class VirtualProcessMethodInvoker
extends Object
implements Runnable

An VirtualProcessMethodInvoker is a Runnable that will call a method through reflection on a class isolated with a specific ClassLoader and return any return value from invoking the method.

If the method is not static an instance of the class will be created.

Copyright (c) 2011. All Rights Reserved. Oracle Corporation.
Oracle is a registered trademark of Oracle Corporation and/or its affiliates.

Author:
Jonathan Knight, Brian Oliver

Constructor Detail

VirtualProcessMethodInvoker

public VirtualProcessMethodInvoker(VirtualizedSystemClassLoader classLoader,
                                   String className,
                                   String methodName,
                                   List<String> arguments)
Constructs a VirtualProcessMethodInvoker.

If the method is not static then an instance of the class will be created by calling the default no-arg constructor.

Parameters:
name - - the name of the process
classLoader - - the ClassLoader to use for isolation of the method invocation
className - - the name of the class to call the method on
methodName - - the name of the method
arguments - - the arguments to pass to the start method

VirtualProcessMethodInvoker

public VirtualProcessMethodInvoker(VirtualizedSystemClassLoader classLoader,
                                   String className,
                                   String methodName,
                                   List<String> args,
                                   Object instance)
Create an instance of InProcessRunner.

If the method is not static then the instance specified will be used to invoke the method. If instance is null an instance of the class will be created by calling the default no-arg constructor.

Parameters:
classLoader - - the ClassLoader to use for isolation of the method invocation
className - - the name of the class to call the method on
methodName - - the name of the method
args - - the arguments to pass to the start method
instance - - the instance of the class to use to invoke the method if the method is not static
